title: Baby in serious condition, one man killed and another injured in Algiers shooting
content:
NEW ORLEANS, LA (WVUE) -
New Orleans police responded Thursday to the scene of a triple shooting in Algiers that left one man dead and another man and a 6-month-old child injured.
The shooting occurred at about 9 p.m. in the 6100 block of Tullis Drive at the entrance to the Cypress Run apartment complex. New Orleans Police Superintendent Michael Harrison said the victims were driving into the complex when they were approached by "at least one subject, perhaps more" who opened fire into their car.
One man died at the scene. Harrison said the baby is listed in serious condition after surgery and another adult male victim is believed to be in fair condition.
"It's heartbreaking. It rips communities apart, it rips families apart, and some people kind of never fully recover from that," Harrison said. "We know all to well what it is like to have lost children in our community."
The chief is urging anyone with information to call Crimestoppers at (504) 822-1111.
